original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / lce'i 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //
translated: Thus, these two dharmas‚Äîthe unarisen and the feeling that arises from the condition of tongue-contact‚Äîare not two and cannot be made two.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the body.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / lus kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unestablished and the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the body, are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the mind.

original: de ltar na mngon par ma grub pa dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba'i chos de gnyis ni gnyis su med de gnyis su byar med do //

translated: Thus, these two dharmas, the unestablished and the feeling that arises from the condition of contact with the mind, are non-dual and indivisible.

original: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
analyzed: mngon par ma grub pa ma gtogs par sa'i khams yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ste /
translated: Apart from the unestablished, they do not see the earth element.

translated: Apart from the non-establishment of the earth element, the water element is not seen.

original: gnyis ni gnyis su byar med do //
analyzed: gnyis ni gnyis su byar med do //
translated: As such, these two phenomena called ‚Äòthe non-establishment of the non-existent‚Äô and ‚Äòthe water element‚Äô are not two, nor are they divided.
